data: OB Induction and Cervical Ripening with Prostaglandin (Module)
Refer to Society of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists of Canada (SOGC) Clinical Practice Guideline Induction of Labour
Refer to Algorithm for Inpatient Induction
Routine, Reason: Pre Cervical Ripening Assessment, once

RELATIVE CONTRAINDICATIONS:  
- Antepartum Hemorrhage (APH)  
- Rupture of Membranes (ROM)  
- Infection
Prepare for #18 single balloon intracervical foley catheter to be introduced into intracervical canal under sterile technique by MD. Inflate bulb with 30 to 60 mL of water.

Prepare for #18 cervical ripening balloon intracervical foley catheter to be introduced into intracervical canal under sterile technique by MD. Inflate each bulb with less than or equal to 80 mL of water.
Continuous for 1 hour post intracervical foley catheter insertion
Assess q15min for 1 hour post administration of prostaglandin
Continuous for 1 hour post administration of prostaglandin
No Exceptions, For 1 hour post administration of prostaglandin or intracervical foley insertion
Prostaglandin should not be used in the setting of trial of labour after cesarean section in the third trimester with a live fetus (risk of uterine rupture)
1 application, vaginal, q6h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: gel
1 application, vaginal, q6h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: gel
10 mg, vaginal, q12h, drug form: insert
10 mg, vaginal, q24h, drug form: insert
50 mcg, PO, q4h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: tab
25 mcg, vaginal, q4h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: tab
1 spray, sublingual, as directed, PRN other (see comment), drug form: spray
